page.title: 14 The Police Force in Keith
page.content: The Police Station in Keith is manned by 1 sergeant,7 constables and 1 police woman.The present Police Station was built in 1893.It has 4 cells,only two of which are in use.Prisoners are held in Keith for a short time only.If they are to be detained for longer,then they are taken to Elgin or Aberdeen.The cells are bare containing nothing with which the arrested person can harm himself or others.A P.C.carries a wooden truncheon,handcuffs,whistle and a personal radio,which he can use to summon help.The Keith Police have one patrol car fitted with a blue flashing light on top and a siren.The average age of offender is 17-25 years old.The main crimes committed are breach of the peace,vandalism and motoring offences.The motto of the police force is Semper Vigilo which means "at all times watchful".
